subject: Public Speaking
title: Jesus and the Sermon on the Mount
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Jesus and the Sermon on the Mount.

hook.text: On a hillside in Galilee, a carpenter's son delivered a speech that would shape two thousand years of civilization.

buildup.text: The Sermon on the Mount reversed every power structure: the meek inherit the earth, the merciful win.

discovery.text: Jesus used simple language, parables, and paradoxes. No jargon, no credentials â€” just radical ideas.

twist.text: Most revolutionary idea: love your enemies. In an occupied nation, this was either wisdom or madness.

climax.text: The speech survived because it was memorable, quotable, and emotionally resonant across centuries and cultures.

quiz.question: What made the Sermon on the Mount so enduring?
